content.question: Read the question carefully. You can receive full credit only by directly answering all aspects of the question. You must answer the question in essay form. An outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. (Note: This exam uses the chronological designations B.C.E. (before the common era) and C.E. (common era). These designations correspond to B.C. (before Christ) and A.D. (anno Domini), which are used in some art history resources.) The image shows a wall plaque from Oba’s palace from the sixteenth century C.E., which represented the significance of an individual’s accomplishments within the kingdom of Benin (Nigeria). Select and completely identify another work of art that depicts an individual or individuals in a way that emphasizes the significance of their accomplishments or actions. You may select a work from the list below or any other relevant work from any geographic area or time period. Describe specific visual characteristics of both the wall plaque and your selected work. Using specific visual evidence from both works, explain at least one similarity and one difference in how the wall plaque and your selected work emphasize the significance of the accomplishments or actions of the individuals depicted. Explain one similarity or one difference in how the wall plaque and your selected work express the values or beliefs of the society in which each work was created. Support your explanation with an example of relevant iconographic (use of symbols) or contextual information from both the wall plaque and your selected work. When identifying the work you select, you should try to include all of the following identifiers: title or designation, name of the artist and/or culture of origin, date of creation, and materials. You will earn credit for the identification if you provide at least two accurate identifiers, but you will not be penalized if any additional identifiers you provide are inaccurate. If you select a work from the list below, you must include at least two accurate identifiers beyond those that are given. The Oath of the HoratiiTheodora panel

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.1: Cultural Contexts of Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Explain how two or more works of art are similar and/or different in how they convey meaning.
